iron ore.Description: Can be smelted into iron ingot.

gold ore.Description: Can be smelted into gold ingot.

stone watering can.Description: Level 1 watering can for watering tilled soil.

bronze watering can.Description: Level 2 watering can for watering tilled soil.

gold watering can.Description: Level 3 watering can for watering tilled soil.

scythe.Description: Used to cut grass and flowers.

raw wing.Description: A popular protein from a duck.

raw filet.Description: A lean protein harvested from a bunny.

wheat.Description: One of the most widely cultivated grains. Makes a great flour for breads and cakes.

yellow onion.Description: Has a distinctive strong and complex flavor.

garlic.Description: Adds a wonderful zestiness to dishes. High quality garlic can be pretty spicy.

radish.Description: A crisp and refreshing root vegetable with hints of pepper when eaten raw.

carrot.Description: A spring tuber with an earthy taste and is full of nutrients.

cauliflower.Description: Valuable, but slow-growing. Despite its pale color, the florets are packed with nutrients.

cabbage.Description: Often used in salads and coleslaws.

red pepper.Description: Very sweet with a spicy aftertaste.

green pepper.Description: A sweet vegetable with a little kick.

strawberry.Description: A sweet, juicy favorite with an appealing red color.

blueberry.Description: A popular and tasty berry reported to have many health benefits.

green bean.Description: A juicy little bean with a cool, crisp snap.

zucchinni.Description: A summer squash packed with nutrients.

corn.Description: One of the most popular grains with many culinary uses.

jalapeno.Description: Fiery hot with a hint of sweetness.

tomato.Description: Rich, red and juicy, the Tomato has a wide variety of culinary uses.

sugar cane.Description: When processed into sugar, it adds a sweetness to baked goods.

asparagus.Description: A small and skinny vegetable packed with nutrients.

wheat seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring, Summer or Fall. Takes 4 days to mature.

potato seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring, Summer or Fall. Takes 6 days to mature and produces one or two potatos on harvest.

yellow onion seeds.Description: Plant these in the Fall. Takes 4 days to mature.

garlic seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring. Takes 8 days to mature.

radish seeds.Description: Plant these in the Summer. Takes 6 days to mature.

carrot seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring. Takes 4 days to mature.

cauliflower seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring. Takes 12 days to mature.

cabbage seeds.Description: Plant these in the Fall. Takes 12 days to mature.

yellow pepper seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring. Takes 6 days to mature and has a chance of producing multiple at harvest.

red pepper seeds.Description: Plant these in the Summer. Takes 6 days to mature and has a chance of producing multiple at harvest.

green pepper seeds.Description: Plant these in the Fall. Takes 6 days to mature and has a chance of producing multiple at harvest.

strawberry seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring. Takes 8 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest. Yields 2 strawberries.

blueberry seeds.Description: Plant these in the Summer. Takes 13 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest. Yields 2 to 4 blueberries.

grape seeds.Description: Plant these in the Fall. Takes 10 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest.

green bean seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring. Takes 10 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest. Yields 1 to 3 green beans.

zucchinni seeds.Description: Plant these in the Spring. Takes 12 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest.

green melon seeds.Description: Plant these in the Summer. Takes 10 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest.

corn seeds.Description: Plant these in the Summer or Fall. Takes 14 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest.

jalapeno seeds.Description: Plant these in the Fall. Takes 8 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest. Has a chance to yield multiple jalapenos at harvest.

tomato seeds.Description: Plant these in the Summer. Takes 11 days to mature and continues to grow after harvest. Has a chance to yield 1 or 2 tomatoes at harvest.

wood path.Description: Place to create paths or decorate your floors.

stone path.Description: Place to create paths or decorate your floors.

house.Description: Large placable shelter with high durability.

grain mill #1.Description: Used to process grains for cooking recipes. Level 1.

grain mill #2.Description: Used to process grains for cooking recipes. Level 2.

grain mill #3.Description: Used to process grains for cooking recipes. Level 3.

tent.Description: Small placable shelter with low durability.

sleeping bag.Description: Can be placed and used to set respawn point in the world.

clownfish.Description: An ocean fish with a bright orange color.

halibut.Description: A large, flat fish with delicious meat.

anchovy.Description: A common fish at the bottom of the food chain.

cisco.Description: A medium sized fish found in the lakes.

goldfish.Description: A rare, cave fish covered in gold.

betta.Description: Despite its beauty and small size, these freshwater fish are known as the Siamese fighting fish.

siberian whitefish.Description: A freshwater fish that hunts during the night.

red salmon.Description: A freshwater fish with a bright, red body and black head.

koi.Description: A unique, freshwater fish that is kept for decoration purposes.

purple salmon.Description: A popular cave fish with a maroon color.

lingcod.Description: An ugly, cave fish with a dark brown color and blue meat.

tilapia.Description: A common, freshwater fish with a mild flavor.

albacore.Description: A large, seawater fish similar to tuna.

purple carp.Description: A cave fish with a dark, purple color and strong fins.

dorado.Description: A freshwater, gamefish with blue and gold colors.

blowfish.Description: A small fish that inflates in size when challenged.

angler.Description: A rare fish that uses a bioluminescent dangler to attack its prey.

seaweed.Description: A salty snack used in cooking.

octopus.Description: An extraordinary, aquatic creature with a very large brain.

shrimp.Description: A small, scavenger widely prized for its meat.

crab.Description: A crustacean with dangerous pincers and delicious meat.

nelma.Description: A large, freshwater fish that is considered a delicacy in some cultures.
